holidays.name: Galentine's Day
holidays.description: A celebration of female friendship, made famous by the TV show "Parks and Recreation," where women gather to honor their lady friends with brunches and gifts before Valentine's Day.
holidays.origin: Popularized by Leslie Knope in "Parks and Recreation" (2010s).
holidays.funFact: Galentine's Day has inspired real-life gatherings, brunches, and even merchandise celebrating gal pals worldwide!

holidays.name: Get a Different Name Day
holidays.description: A day to consider the fun and freedom of picking a new name for yourself, whether just for fun or to reinvent your identity.
holidays.funFact: Many people use this day to brainstorm character names for stories or even experiment with nicknames for themselves.

holidays.name: Peanut Butter Lover's Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to celebrating the creamy and crunchy joy of peanut butter, this day encourages indulging in all things peanut butter—sandwiches, cookies, and more!
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday, likely started by peanut butter fans and brands.
holidays.funFact: Peanut butter was introduced in the late 19th century as a nutritious protein source and became a staple comfort food, especially in the U.S.

holidays.name: Blame Someone Else Day
holidays.description: A tongue-in-cheek holiday where you can humorously 'blame' others for your mishaps for one day, turning responsibility into comic relief.
holidays.origin: Unofficial, humorous observance created to lighten the mood.
holidays.funFact: This day serves as a reminder not to take ourselves too seriously and to recognize the value of personal accountability every other day!
